Incident Title: (National Billing System ) (Unable to login)
Incident Description: When verifying mcaf-m in NBS, the system confirms the entry, but it does not appear in the interim bill. Steps to reproduce include navigating to the billing section, verifying mcaf-m, and checking the interim bill. The issue affects multiple users in the billing department, causing delays. The expected outcome is for verified mcaf-m to reflect in the interim bill, but it remains missing, leading to incomplete billing information.
Incident Resolution: The root cause was identified as a resource exhaustion issue on one of the shared database clusters that supports multiple NBS applications. A spike in background job executions, triggered by a misconfigured report scheduler, led to unusually high CPU and I/O usage during peak working hours. System performance has returned to normal.

Incident Title: BS staging environment not able to access. Logon (devhealthgrp.com.sg)
Incident Description: When attempting to tag the GPfirst insurance code [SR] in the billing system, an error message appears stating 'Tagging Failed.' The issue occurs when selecting the insurance code from the dropdown menu and clicking 'Apply.' The expected outcome is the code being successfully tagged and saved, but instead, the system returns an error. This issue affects multiple users and prevents accurate insurance billing.
Incident Resolution: The root cause was identified as a resource exhaustion issue on one of the shared database clusters that supports multiple NBS applications. A spike in background job executions, triggered by a misconfigured report scheduler, led to unusually high CPU and I/O usage during peak working hours. System performance has returned to normal.

Incident Title: EMAIL - [For Action] [NBS/eFC device preparation] TTSH eForms Topaz Driver Installation Exercise>
Incident Description: When attempting to switch between patient records in the NBS system, the context switch feature becomes unresponsive. Users have reported that after selecting a different patient or billing screen, the system freezes or fails to load the new context. The issue affects multiple users across different departments, leading to delays in processing billing requests. The expected outcome is seamless navigation between records, but the actual result is a system hang requiring manual restart.
Incident Resolution: The root cause was identified as a resource exhaustion issue on one of the shared database clusters that supports multiple NBS applications. A spike in background job executions, triggered by a misconfigured report scheduler, led to unusually high CPU and I/O usage during peak working hours. System performance has returned to normal.

Incident Title: (NBS) (Unable to login)
Incident Description: When attempting to sign forms in eFORM through NBS, an error message is displayed, preventing successful form submission. The issue occurs after selecting 'Submit' following form completion. Multiple users across departments have encountered this problem. The expected outcome is a confirmation of form submission, but the actual result is an error message, causing delays in form processing.
Incident Resolution: The root cause was identified as a resource exhaustion issue on one of the shared database clusters that supports multiple NBS applications. A spike in background job executions, triggered by a misconfigured report scheduler, led to unusually high CPU and I/O usage during peak working hours. System performance has returned to normal.

Incident Title: test login failed before nbs goes live
Incident Description: When attempting to retrieve the R005 Charge Interface Error Report, users have noticed that the report is being generated and sent outside of the expected timeframe. The issue affects multiple departments relying on timely report availability. The expected outcome is to receive the report during designated business hours, but it is currently being sent at inconvenient times, causing delays in addressing charge interface errors.
Incident Resolution: The root cause was identified as a resource exhaustion issue on one of the shared database clusters that supports multiple NBS applications. A spike in background job executions, triggered by a misconfigured report scheduler, led to unusually high CPU and I/O usage during peak working hours. System performance has returned to normal.

Incident Title: Unable to login
Incident Description: When attempting to retrieve billable events using CSN Nos. 100224307872, 100246462562, 100249238046, and 100250618992 in Manage Billable Events, the system fails to display the events. Steps: 1) Log in, 2) Navigate to Manage Billable Events, 3) Enter CSN numbers, 4) Click search. Actual outcome: Events not shown; error message appears. Expected outcome: Events should display with details. Issue affects multiple users, causing reporting delays.
Incident Resolution: The root cause was identified as a resource exhaustion issue on one of the shared database clusters that supports multiple NBS applications. A spike in background job executions, triggered by a misconfigured report scheduler, led to unusually high CPU and I/O usage during peak working hours. System performance has returned to normal.

Incident Title: unable to login
Incident Description: When attempting to process transactions at ED Counter 10, the UPOS command bridge was found not set up for both workstations. Users expected the system to automatically connect to the UPOS bridge for payment processing, but the connection is missing. This issue affects multiple users at the counter, leading to failed transactions. The expected outcome was seamless integration, but the system currently cannot process payments due to the missing setup.
Incident Resolution: The root cause was identified as a resource exhaustion issue on one of the shared database clusters that supports multiple NBS applications. A spike in background job executions, triggered by a misconfigured report scheduler, led to unusually high CPU and I/O usage during peak working hours. System performance has returned to normal.

Incident Description: When attempting to process transactions at counter 10, the UPOS integration is missing, preventing payment processing. This issue impacts multiple departments, disrupting accurate billing processes. The expected outcome was successful category addition, but the system currently prevents it, leading to delays and manual workarounds.
Incident Resolution: The root cause was identified as a resource exhaustion issue on one of the shared database clusters that supports multiple NBS applications. A spike in background job executions, triggered by a misconfigured report scheduler, led to unusually high CPU and I/O usage during peak working hours. System performance has returned to normal.

The expected outcome is to receive the report during designated business hours, but it is currently being sent at inconvenient times, causing delays in addressing charge interface errors.
Incident Resolution: The root cause was identified as a resource exhaustion issue on one of the shared database clusters that supports multiple NBS applications. A spike in background job executions, triggered by a misconfigured report scheduler, led to unusually high CPU and I/O usage during peak working hours. System performance has returned to normal.

Incident Resolution: The root cause was identified as a resource exhaustion issue on one of the shared database clusters that supports multiple NBS applications. A spike in background job executions, triggered by a misconfigured report scheduler, led to unusually high CPU and I/O usage during peak working hours. System performance has returned to normal.

Incident Resolution: The root cause was identified as a resource exhaustion issue on one of the shared database clusters that supports multiple NBS applications. This issue affects multiple users at the counter, leading to failed transactions. The expected outcome was seamless integration, but the system currently cannot process payments due to the missing setup.
Incident Resolution: The root cause was identified as a resource exhaustion issue on one of the shared database clusters that supports multiple NBS applications. A spike in background job executions, triggered by a misconfigured report scheduler, led to unusually high CPU and I/O usage during peak working hours. System performance has returned to normal.

Steps to reproduce: 1) Log in, 2) Navigate to Manage Billable Events, 3) Enter CSN No. 100250781709. Actual outcome: 30-minute delay before retrieval. Expected outcome: Immediate retrieval. This issue affects multiple users, causing delays in processing billable events.
Incident Resolution: The root cause was identified as a resource exhaustion issue on one of the shared database clusters that supports multiple NBS applications. A spike in background job executions, triggered by a misconfigured report scheduler, led to unusually high CPU and I/O usage during peak working hours. System performance has returned to normal.
